hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{5}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{2}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 2](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d91b32ffa89b0a4fc38a647b661793ad61ac40b4)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{2}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{5}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 5, 10. Arrows labeled, plus 5, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/556f120cfcf1ee4a82165d23b1ca330b922cc787)

$\blueD{2} \times \maroonD{5} = \underbrace{\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}}_{\blueD{2}\maroonD{\text{ fives}}}=\greenD{10}$

So $\maroonD{5}\times\blueD{2}=\greenD{10}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$5 \times 2 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
